citeinfo.origin: National Park Service, Wrangell St. Elias National Park
citeinfo.title: Wrangell-Elias Vegetation Ground Plots

descript.abstract: Data Type: ; Spatially referenced vegetation ground plot data collected over a 12 year period throughout Wrangell St. Elias National Park. Vegetative species information and related canopy cover data was collected from ground plots. Plots have been classified using the Alaska Vegetation Classification Scheme. All plots have been referenced on Alaska High Altitude Color Infrared photography at 1:63360 scale. The collection of this data was supported by the regional fire program to provide ground information as to fire fuels for Wrangell St. Elias National Park. These plots have been used for other applications as supportive information for landcover mapping, habitat interpretations, general vegetation knowledge, etc. A Vegetation Survey effort has been underway at the park for approximately 12 years and recently has expanded. Rare plant surveys are currently being conducted as well. All collection points are now spatially referenced with GPS systems.

idinfo.useconst: Data is spatially located on color infrared aerial photography and has not yet been automated in a GIS system. Attribute data has been automated by Wrangell St. Elias National Park in database management system.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.

cntaddr.address: NOAA / AFSC / PMEL, 7600 Sand Point Way N.E.
